verses.text: Pursue love, but ardently desire spiritual gifts, rather, however, that you may prophesy.

sinaiticus.text: For he that speaks in a tongue speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands, though in spirit he speaks mysteries;

verses.text: For he that speaks in a tongue speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands, though in spirit he speaks mysteries;

sinaiticus.text: but he that prophesies speaks to men edification, and exhortation, and comfort.

verses.text: but he that prophesies speaks to men edification, and exhortation, and comfort.

sinaiticus.text: He that speaks in a tongue edifies himself; but he that prophesies edifies the church.

verses.text: He that speaks in a tongue edifies himself; but he that prophesies edifies the church.

sinaiticus.text: Now, I wish you all to speak in tongues, but rather that you prophesy; and greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks in tongues, unless he interpret, that the church may receive edification.

verses.text: Now, I wish you all to speak in tongues, but rather that you prophesy; and greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks in tongues, unless he interpret, that the church may receive edification.

sinaiticus.text: But now, brethren, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I shall speak to you either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching?

verses.text: But now, brethren, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I shall speak to you either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching?

sinaiticus.text: Even things without life, giving sound, whether pipe or harp, yet, if they give not a distinction in tones, how shall that be known which is piped or harped?

verses.text: Even things without life, giving sound, whether pipe or harp, yet, if they give not a distinction in tones, how shall that be known which is piped or harped?

sinaiticus.text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself for battle?

verses.text: For if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself for battle?

sinaiticus.text: So, unless you also, through the tongue, give a word easy to be understood, how shall that be known which is spoken? for you shall

sinaiticus.text: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and no one of them without signification:

verses.text: There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and no one of them without signification:

sinaiticus.text: if, then, I know not the power of the voice, I shall be to him that speaks a barbarian, and he that speaks a barbarian, in my judgment.

verses.text: if, then, I know not the power of the voice, I shall be to him that speaks a barbarian, and he that speaks a barbarian, in my judgment.

sinaiticus.text: So also you, since you are ardently desirous of spirits, seek that you may abound with a view to the edification of the church.

verses.text: So also you, since you are ardently desirous of spirits, seek that you may abound with a view to the edification of the church.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, let him that speaks with a tongue pray that he may interpret.

verses.text: Wherefore, let him that speaks with a tongue pray that he may interpret.

sinaiticus.text: For if I pray with a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.

verses.text: For if I pray with a tongue, my spirit prays, but my mind is unfruitful.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, is it? I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray with the mind also: I will sing with the spirit, but I will sing with the mind also.

verses.text: What, then, is it? I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray with the mind also: I will sing with the spirit, but I will sing with the mind also.

sinaiticus.text: Else, if thou shalt have blessed with the spirit, he that occupies the place of the unlearned, how shall he say the amen at thy giving of thanks? since he knows not what thou sayest;

verses.text: Else, if thou shalt have blessed with the spirit, he that occupies the place of the unlearned, how shall he say the amen at thy giving of thanks? since he knows not what thou sayest;

sinaiticus.text: for thou indeed givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

verses.text: for thou indeed givest thanks well, but the other is not edified.

sinaiticus.text: I thank God, I speak with a tongue more than you all;

verses.text: I thank God, I speak with a tongue more than you all;

sinaiticus.text: but in the church I prefer to speak five words through my mind, that I may instruct others also, than ten thousand words in a tongue.

verses.text: but in the church I prefer to speak five words through my mind, that I may instruct others also, than ten thousand words in a tongue.

sinaiticus.text: Brethren, become not little children in understanding, but in malice be childlike, but in understanding become full-grown men.

verses.text: Brethren, become not little children in understanding, but in malice be childlike, but in understanding become full-grown men.

sinaiticus.text: In the law it is written: In words of another tongue and in other lips will I speak to this people, and not even thus will they hearken to me, says the Lord.

verses.text: In the law it is written: In words of another tongue and in other lips will I speak to this people, and not even thus will they hearken to me, says the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, the tongues are for a sign, not for the believers, but for the unbelievers, but prophecy, not for the unbelievers, but for the believers.

verses.text: So, then, the tongues are for a sign, not for the believers, but for the unbelievers, but prophecy, not for the unbelievers, but for the believers.

sinaiticus.text: If, then, the whole church shall have come together into the same place, and all speak with tongues, but there come in unlearned men or unbelievers, will they not say that you are mad?

verses.text: If, then, the whole church shall have come together into the same place, and all speak with tongues, but there come in unlearned men or unbelievers, will they not say that you are mad?

sinaiticus.text: But if all prophesy, and there come in any unbeliever or unlearned man, he is convinced by all, he is judged by all;

verses.text: But if all prophesy, and there come in any unbeliever or unlearned man, he is convinced by all, he is judged by all;

sinaiticus.text: the secrets of his heart become manifest; and so, falling on his face, he will worship God, reporting that in reality God is in you.

verses.text: the secrets of his heart become manifest; and so, falling on his face, he will worship God, reporting that in reality God is in you.

sinaiticus.text: What, then, is it, brethren? When you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a tongue, has an interpretation: let all things be done with a view to edification.

verses.text: What, then, is it, brethren? When you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a tongue, has an interpretation: let all things be done with a view to edification.

sinaiticus.text: If any one speaks with a tongue, by twos, or, at most, by threes, and in turn, and let one interpret;

verses.text: If any one speaks with a tongue, by twos, or, at most, by threes, and in turn, and let one interpret;

sinaiticus.text: but if there be no interpreter, let him be silent in the church, but let him speak to himself and to God.

verses.text: but if there be no interpreter, let him be silent in the church, but let him speak to himself and to God.

sinaiticus.text: And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others discern;312

verses.text: And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others discern;312

verses.text: but if a revelation be made to another sitting by, let the first be silent.

sinaiticus.text: For you can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all be comforted.

verses.text: For you can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all be comforted.

sinaiticus.text: And the spirits of prophets are subject to prophets;

verses.text: And the spirits of prophets are subject to prophets;

sinaiticus.text: for God is not of disorder, but of peace. As in all the churches of the saints,

verses.text: for God is not of disorder, but of peace. As in all the churches of the saints,

sinaiticus.text: let your women be silent in the churches; for it is not permitted to them to speak, but to be in subjection, as the law also says.

verses.text: let your women be silent in the churches; for it is not permitted to them to speak, but to be in subjection, as the law also says.

sinaiticus.text: But if they wish to learn any thing, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is a shame to a woman to speak in a church.

verses.text: But if they wish to learn any thing, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is a shame to a woman to speak in a church.

sinaiticus.text: Or came the word of God out from you, or to you only did it come?

verses.text: Or came the word of God out from you, or to you only did it come?

sinaiticus.text: If any one thinks he is a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge the things which I write. that they are of the Lord;

verses.text: If any one thinks he is a prophet or spiritual, let him acknowledge the things which I write. that they are of the Lord;

sinaiticus.text: but if one is ignorant, let him be ignorant.

verses.text: but if one is ignorant, let him be ignorant.

sinaiticus.text: So then, brethren, ardently desire to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues;

verses.text: So then, brethren, ardently desire to prophesy, and forbid not to speak with tongues;

sinaiticus.text: but let all things be done in a becoming manner and in order.

verses.text: but let all things be done in a becoming manner and in order.

sinaiticus.text: Corinthians 15

verses.text: Corinthians 15

sinaiticus.text: Moreover, I make known to you, brethren, the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received, in which also you have stood.

verses.text: Moreover, I make known to you, brethren, the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received, in which also you have stood.

sinaiticus.text: through which also you are saved, if you hold fast with what word I preached to you, unless you believed in vain.

verses.text: through which also you are saved, if you hold fast with what word I preached to you, unless you believed in vain.

sinaiticus.text: For I delivered to you, among the first things, that which I also received; that Christ died for our sins, according to the Scriptures;

verses.text: For I delivered to you, among the first things, that which I also received; that Christ died for our sins, according to the Scriptures;

sinaiticus.text: and that he was buried; and that he rose from the dead on the third day, according to the Scriptures;

verses.text: and that he was buried; and that he rose from the dead on the third day, according to the Scriptures;

sinaiticus.text: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

verses.text: and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

sinaiticus.text: After that he appeared to more than five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain till now, but some have also fallen asleep.

verses.text: After that he appeared to more than five hundred brethren at once, of whom the greater part remain till now, but some have also fallen asleep.

sinaiticus.text: After that he appeared to James, after that to all the apostles.

verses.text: After that he appeared to James, after that to all the apostles.

sinaiticus.text: But, last of all, as to the one born out of due time, he appeared to me also.

verses.text: But, last of all, as to the one born out of due time, he appeared to me also.

sinaiticus.text: For I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God;

verses.text: For I am the least of the apostles, who am not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God;

sinaiticus.text: but by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace which was for me became not vain, but I labored more abundantly than they all: not I, however, but the grace of God which was with me.

verses.text: but by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace which was for me became not vain, but I labored more abundantly than they all: not I, however, but the grace of God which was with me.

sinaiticus.text: But if Christ is preached that he has risen from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

verses.text: But if Christ is preached that he has risen from the dead, how say some among you that there is no resurrection of the dead?

sinaiticus.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised;

verses.text: But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised;

sinaiticus.text: and if Christ has not been raised, vain then both what we preached, and vain also your faith:

verses.text: and if Christ has not been raised, vain then both what we preached, and vain also your faith:

sinaiticus.text: further, we are also found false witnesses of God, because we testified against God that he raised up Christ whom lie did not raise, if indeed then the dead are not raised.

verses.text: further, we are also found false witnesses of God, because we testified against God that he raised up Christ whom lie did not raise, if indeed then the dead are not raised.

sinaiticus.text: For if the dead are not raised, neither has Christ been raised;

verses.text: For if the dead are not raised, neither has Christ been raised;

sinaiticus.text: but if Christ has not been raised, fruitless your faith, you are yet in your sins:

verses.text: but if Christ has not been raised, fruitless your faith, you are yet in your sins:

sinaiticus.text: then also those that have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

verses.text: then also those that have fallen asleep in Christ have perished.

sinaiticus.text: If only in this life we have been hoping in Christ, more miserable than all men are we.

verses.text: If only in this life we have been hoping in Christ, more miserable than all men are we.

sinaiticus.text: But now has Christ been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those that have slept.

verses.text: But now has Christ been raised from the dead, the firstfruits of those that have slept.

sinaiticus.text: For since through man death, through man also the resurrection of the dead.

verses.text: For since through man death, through man also the resurrection of the dead.

sinaiticus.text: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.

verses.text: For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ shall all be made alive.

sinaiticus.text: But each one in his own order; the firstfruit Christ, afterward those that are Christ’s at his coming:

verses.text: But each one in his own order; the firstfruit Christ, afterward those that are Christ’s at his coming:

sinaiticus.text: then the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to the God and Father, when he shall have destroyed all principality and all authority and power.

verses.text: then the end, when he shall have delivered up the kingdom to the God and Father, when he shall have destroyed all principality and all authority and power.

sinaiticus.text: For he must reign till he shall have put all enemies under his feet.

verses.text: For he must reign till he shall have put all enemies under his feet.

sinaiticus.text: Death, the last enemy, shall be destroyed.

verses.text: Death, the last enemy, shall be destroyed.

sinaiticus.text: For he has put all things under his feet. But when he shall have said that all things have been subjected, it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him;

verses.text: For he has put all things under his feet. But when he shall have said that all things have been subjected, it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him;

sinaiticus.text: but when all things shall have been subjected to him, then shall the Son also be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be the all in all.

verses.text: but when all things shall have been subjected to him, then shall the Son also be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be the all in all.

sinaiticus.text: Otherwise, what shall they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are they even baptized for them?

verses.text: Otherwise, what shall they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead are not raised at all, why are they even baptized for them?

sinaiticus.text: Why also are we in danger every hour?

verses.text: Why also are we in danger every hour?

sinaiticus.text: I protest by the rejoicing over you, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

verses.text: I protest by the rejoicing over you, brethren, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily.

sinaiticus.text: If as a man I fought with wild beasts in Ephesus, what advantage is it to me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

verses.text: If as a man I fought with wild beasts in Ephesus, what advantage is it to me? If the dead are not raised, let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.

sinaiticus.text: Be not deceived: Evil communications corrupt good manners.314

verses.text: Be not deceived: Evil communications corrupt good manners.314

sinaiticus.text: Awake to sobriety, as it is right, and sin not: for ignorance of God some have. For shame to you I speak.

verses.text: Awake to sobriety, as it is right, and sin not: for ignorance of God some have. For shame to you I speak.

sinaiticus.text: But some one will say: How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

verses.text: But some one will say: How are the dead raised up? and with what body do they come?

sinaiticus.text: Foolish man, that which thou sowest is not made alive unless it die;

verses.text: Foolish man, that which thou sowest is not made alive unless it die;

sinaiticus.text: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be produced, but naked grain it may be of wheat, or some of the rest;

verses.text: and that which thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be produced, but naked grain it may be of wheat, or some of the rest;

sinaiticus.text: but God gives it a body as it pleased him, and to each of the seeds its own body.

verses.text: but God gives it a body as it pleased him, and to each of the seeds its own body.

sinaiticus.text: All flesh is not the same flesh, but one indeed of men, but another flesh of beasts, but another flesh of birds, but another of fishes.

verses.text: All flesh is not the same flesh, but one indeed of men, but another flesh of beasts, but another flesh of birds, but another of fishes.

sinaiticus.text: And there are bodies celestial, and bodies terrestrial; but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial another.

verses.text: And there are bodies celestial, and bodies terrestrial; but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial another.

sinaiticus.text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for star differs from star in glory.

verses.text: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for star differs from star in glory.

sinaiticus.text: So also the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption.

verses.text: So also the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruption.

sinaiticus.text: It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power:

verses.text: It is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power:

sinaiticus.text: it is sown a psychical body*, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a psychical body, there is also a spiritual body. * soma psuchikon = flesh soulish or soulish flesh. ed.

verses.text: it is sown a psychical body*, it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a psychical body, there is also a spiritual body. * soma psuchikon = flesh soulish or soulish flesh. ed.

sinaiticus.text: So also it is written: The first man Adam was made a living soul, the last Adam a life-giving spirit.

verses.text: So also it is written: The first man Adam was made a living soul, the last Adam a life-giving spirit.

sinaiticus.text: But not first the spiritual, but the psychical: after that the spiritual.

verses.text: But not first the spiritual, but the psychical: after that the spiritual.

sinaiticus.text: The first man is from the earth, earthy; the second man, from heaven.

verses.text: The first man is from the earth, earthy; the second man, from heaven.

sinaiticus.text: As the earthy, such also the earthy; and as the heavenly, such also the heavenly;

verses.text: As the earthy, such also the earthy; and as the heavenly, such also the heavenly;

sinaiticus.text: and as we have worn the image of the earthy, we shall also wear the image of the heavenly.

verses.text: and as we have worn the image of the earthy, we shall also wear the image of the heavenly.

sinaiticus.text: But this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, neither does corruption inherit incorruption.

verses.text: But this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit the kingdom of God, neither does corruption inherit incorruption.

sinaiticus.text: Behold, I tell you a mystery; we shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

verses.text: Behold, I tell you a mystery; we shall not all sleep, but we shall all be changed,

sinaiticus.text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

verses.text: in a moment, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

sinaiticus.text: For this corruptible must put on incorruptibility, and this mortal

verses.text: For this corruptible must put on incorruptibility, and this mortal

sinaiticus.text: And when this corruptible shall have put on incorruptibility, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written: Death is swallowed up in victory.

verses.text: And when this corruptible shall have put on incorruptibility, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the saying that is written: Death is swallowed up in victory.

sinaiticus.text: Where thy sting, O death? Where thy victory, O death?

verses.text: Where thy sting, O death? Where thy victory, O death?

sinaiticus.text: The sting of death is sin, but the strength of sin is the law.

verses.text: The sting of death is sin, but the strength of sin is the law.

sinaiticus.text: But thanks to God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.text: But thanks to God who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

sinaiticus.text: So then, my beloved brethren, become steadfast, immovable, abounding in the work of the Lord always, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

verses.text: So then, my beloved brethren, become steadfast, immovable, abounding in the work of the Lord always, knowing that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Corinthians 16

verses.text: Corinthians 16

sinaiticus.text: But concerning the collection which is for the saints, as I gave order to the churches of Galatia, so also do you.

verses.text: But concerning the collection which is for the saints, as I gave order to the churches of Galatia, so also do you.

sinaiticus.text: On every first day of the week let each one of you lay by himself, treasuring up whatever he has been prospered, that there be no collections when I come.

verses.text: On every first day of the week let each one of you lay by himself, treasuring up whatever he has been prospered, that there be no collections when I come.

sinaiticus.text: And when I have come, whomever you may approve, these will I send with letters to bear your favor to Jerusalem;

verses.text: And when I have come, whomever you may approve, these will I send with letters to bear your favor to Jerusalem;

sinaiticus.text: and if it be worth my going also, they shall go with me.

verses.text: and if it be worth my going also, they shall go with me.

sinaiticus.text: But I will come to you when I shall have passed through Macedonia;

verses.text: But I will come to you when I shall have passed through Macedonia;

sinaiticus.text: for I am going through Macedonia, but with you, it may be, I shall remain or even spend the winter, that you may send me forward wherever I may go.

verses.text: for I am going through Macedonia, but with you, it may be, I shall remain or even spend the winter, that you may send me forward wherever I may go.

sinaiticus.text: For I do not wish to see you now in passing; for I hope to remain some time with you, if the Lord permit.

verses.text: For I do not wish to see you now in passing; for I hope to remain some time with you, if the Lord permit.

sinaiticus.text: But I shall abide in Ephesus till Pentecost;

verses.text: But I shall abide in Ephesus till Pentecost;

sinaiticus.text: for there has been opened to me a door great and effectual, and there are many adversaries.

verses.text: for there has been opened to me a door great and effectual, and there are many adversaries.

sinaiticus.text: Now if Timothy come, see that he be with you without fear; for he works the work of the Lord as I also do:

verses.text: Now if Timothy come, see that he be with you without fear; for he works the work of the Lord as I also do:

sinaiticus.text: let no one therefore despise him. But send him forward in peace, that he may come to me; for I wait for him with the brethren.

verses.text: let no one therefore despise him. But send him forward in peace, that he may come to me; for I wait for him with the brethren.

sinaiticus.text: But concerning Apollos the brother, I exhorted him much to come to you with the brethren; and his will was not at all to come now; but he will come when he shall have opportunity.

verses.text: But concerning Apollos the brother, I exhorted him much to come to you with the brethren; and his will was not at all to come now; but he will come when he shall have opportunity.

sinaiticus.text: Watch, stand firm in the faith, act like men, be strong.

verses.text: Watch, stand firm in the faith, act like men, be strong.

sinaiticus.text: Let all your deeds be done in love.

verses.text: Let all your deeds be done in love.

sinaiticus.text: Now I beseech you, brethren: you know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruit of Achaia, and they have given themselves to the ministry of the saints:316

verses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren: you know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruit of Achaia, and they have given themselves to the ministry of the saints:316

sinaiticus.text: that you also submit yourselves to those that are such, and to every one that works with me and labors.

verses.text: that you also submit yourselves to those that are such, and to every one that works with me and labors.

sinaiticus.text: But I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus, because they have supplied the want of you;

verses.text: But I rejoice at the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus, because they have supplied the want of you;

sinaiticus.text: for they have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge those that are such.

verses.text: for they have refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore acknowledge those that are such.

sinaiticus.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Prisca, with the church that is in their house, salute you much in the Lord.

verses.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Prisca, with the church that is in their house, salute you much in the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

verses.text: All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss.

sinaiticus.text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand.

verses.text: The salutation of Paul with my own hand.

sinaiticus.text: If any one loves not the Lord, let him be accursed. The Lord comes.

verses.text: If any one loves not the Lord, let him be accursed. The Lord comes.

sinaiticus.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.
